name: Amiga Solitaire
overview: Released in English and eventually in Polish, this solitaire game was created by David W. Meny and Albert Penello and released in 1991. An Amiga implementation of the "Klondike" solitaire with a totally mouse-driven, OS-friendly interface. There are settings for if the game should keep times, if the deck should be flipped one or three cards at a time, how many times one may flip through the deck, an undo function and a cheat function to glimpse through a stack. There are six decks to choose from, including one with the Amiga checkmark and one with a Batman theme.
